description: Iconic Alpha rare artifact. Adds three mana of any color to your mana pool, then is sacrificed. One of the most valuable MTG cards in existence.
name: Black Lotus

description: Powerful planeswalker with four versatile abilities including card manipulation, bouncing creatures, and milling. Considered one of the strongest planeswalkers ever printed.
name: Jace, the Mind Sculptor

description: Legendary Modern staple creature whose power and toughness are equal to the number of card types in all graveyards. Often a very efficient threat for its mana cost.
name: Tarmogoyf

description: Classic blue counterspell that can be cast for free by exiling a blue card from your hand and paying 1 life. Essential in Legacy and Vintage formats.
name: Force of Will

description: Powerful black planeswalker that forces all players to discard, can remove creatures, and can separate permanents into two piles for sacrifice. Format staple in Modern.
name: Liliana of the Veil

description: Part of the Power Nine, this zero-cost artifact taps to add blue mana to your mana pool. Reserved List card with extreme rarity and value.
name: Mox Sapphire

description: Powerful Simic (Green/Blue) Elder Giant that gains life, draws cards, and ramps lands. Can escape from your graveyard for continued value.
name: Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath

description: Legendary land that taps for three colorless mana that can only be spent on artifact spells. Reserved List card and Vintage staple.
name: Mishra's Workshop

description: One of the Power Nine cards. One blue mana to draw three cards, making it the most efficient card draw spell ever printed.
name: Ancestral Recall

description: Power Nine card that allows you to take an extra turn for just two mana. One of the most broken cards in Magic's history.
name: Time Walk

description: Part of the Power Nine, this zero-cost artifact taps to add red mana to your mana pool. Enables explosive first turns.
name: Mox Ruby

description: Original dual land that can tap for either blue or black mana without coming into play tapped. Reserved List staple for Legacy and Vintage.
name: Underground Sea

description: Original dual land that taps for blue or red mana. No drawback, unlike modern dual lands. On the Reserved List.
name: Volcanic Island

description: Original dual land that produces black or green mana without entering tapped. Reserved List card essential for many Commander decks.
name: Bayou

description: Powerful Gruul planeswalker that can recur lands from your graveyard and ping creatures. Modern and Legacy staple.
name: Wrenn and Six

description: Efficient red monkey pirate that generates treasures and can steal cards from opponents' libraries. Format-defining card in Modern.
name: Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer

description: Zero-cost artifact that taps for two colorless mana with only a small risk of damage to you. Powerful in Commander and Vintage.
name: Mana Crypt

description: Legendary land that gives all creatures an upkeep cost, punishing token and creature-heavy strategies. Reserved List.
name: The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale

description: Legendary land that taps to add green mana equal to the number of creatures you control. Reserved List card extremely powerful in creature decks.
name: Gaea's Cradle

description: Land that makes colored mana for creature spells of a chosen type, and makes those spells uncounterable. Tribal deck staple.
name: Cavern of Souls

description: Legendary 15/15 Eldrazi with flying, protection from colored spells, annihilator 6, and an extra turn when cast. Nearly unbeatable once resolved.
name: Emrakul, the Aeons Torn

description: Banned in all formats, this card creates a subgame within the main game. Infamous for making tournaments run too long.
name: Shahrazad

description: Banned in multiple formats, this 3-mana planeswalker can turn opponents' powerful creatures into mere Elks. One of the most broken planeswalkers ever.
name: Oko, Thief of Crowns

description: Red goblin that creates Treasure tokens equal to the number of artifacts and enchantments your opponents control. Commander staple.
name: Dockside Extortionist
